info.title: IA-Connect UI
info.description: IA-Connect is a Robotic Process Automation (RPA) platform which adds RPA functionality from the Cloud to on-premises virtual machines or over Citrix or Microsoft Remote Desktop (RDS) connections. This is the module for Windows application User Interface Automation (UIA).

post.summary: Does top level Win32 window exist
post.description: A fast Win32 action which reports whether a top-level Win32 window exists. A top-level window is one which is connected to the desktop. You can search by class name or window title, or you can specify more advanced search filters, including wildcards. Although this action uses Win32 APIs, it can detect Windows, Java, ModernUI and Web windows. The window must exist, IA-Connect will not wait. It is more common to use the UIA action 'Does UIA desktop element exist' which is more powerful, but this Win32 action typically executes faster.

SearchClassName.title: Search class name
SearchClassName.description: The element class name of the top level window to search for, e.g. 'Notepad'.

SearchWindowTitle.title: Search window title
SearchWindowTitle.description: The title of the top level window to search for.

SearchProcessId.title: Search process Id
SearchProcessId.description: The optional process Id of the process which owns the window (for example, as provided by the output of the 'Run Process' action in the IA-Connect Environment / Session actions). Set to 0 to not search by process Id.

MatchIndex.title: Match index
MatchIndex.description: If multiple elements match the search, which element (starting at 1) should be matched. Can be used in conjunction with 'Sort by column' to choose the sort order for matching.

SearchFilter.title: Search filter
SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators against available window properties. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Title] like '*Excel' AND [IsMinimised] = False AND [IsResizeable] = True. See the documentation for more examples.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

WindowExists.title: Window exists
WindowExists.description: Returns true if the window exists or false if not.

post.summary: Get UIA handle for top level Win32 window
post.description: A fast Win32 action which returns a UIA handle for any top-level Win32 window which has the specified class name or window title, or you can specify more advanced search filters, including wildcards. A top-level window is one which is connected to the desktop. Although this action uses Win32 APIs, it can detect Windows, Java, ModernUI and Web windows. The window must exist, IA-Connect will not wait. It is more common to use the UIA action 'Does UIA desktop element exist' which is more powerful, but this Win32 action typically executes faster.

SearchClassName.title: Search class name
SearchClassName.description: The element class name of the top level window to search for, e.g. 'Notepad'.

SearchWindowTitle.title: Search window title
SearchWindowTitle.description: The title of the top level window to search for.

SearchProcessId.title: Search process Id
SearchProcessId.description: The optional process Id of the process which owns the window (for example, as provided by the output of the 'Run Process' action in the IA-Connect Environment / Session actions). Set to 0 to not search by process Id.

MatchIndex.title: Match index
MatchIndex.description: If multiple elements match the search, which element (starting at 1) should be matched. Can be used in conjunction with 'Sort by column' to choose the sort order for matching.

SearchFilter.title: Search filter
SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators against available window properties. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Title] like '*Excel' AND [IsMinimised] = False AND [IsResizeable] = True. See the documentation for more examples.

SortByColumn.title: Sort by column name
SortByColumn.description: If multiple windows match the search, this allows you to specify which window property to sort by. This will be used in conjunction with 'Match index' to pick the required window. For example: If 'Sort by column name' is [TopEdge] and 'Match index' is 1 then the matching window nearest the top of the screen will be returned.

MatchIndexAscending.title: Match index is ascending
MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple windows match the search, should 'Match index' match from the top of the sorted list (true) or from the bottom of the sorted list (false).

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

WindowHandle.title: Window handle
WindowHandle.description: The UIA handle for the window. This can be used as an input to further UIA actions within this window.

ElementName.title: Element name
ElementName.description: The UIA name of the window element.

ElementClassName.title: Element class name
ElementClassName.description: The UIA class name of the window element.

ElementAutomationId.description: The UIA automation Id of the window element.

ElementLocalizedControlType.description: The UIA localized control type of the window element.

post.summary: Wait for UIA top level Win32 window
post.description: A fast Win32 action which waits for a specified time for a top-level Win32 window to exist before returning a UIA handle. A top-level window is one which is connected to the desktop. You can search by class name or window title, or you can specify more advanced search filters, including wildcards. Although this action uses Win32 APIs, it can detect Windows, Java, ModernUI and Web windows. It is more common to use the UIA action 'Wait for desktop element' which is more powerful, but this Win32 action typically executes faster.

SearchClassName.title: Search class name
SearchClassName.description: The element class name of the top level window to search for, e.g. 'Notepad'.

SearchWindowTitle.title: Search window title
SearchWindowTitle.description: The title of the top level window to search for.

SecondsToWait.title: Seconds to wait
SecondsToWait.description: The maximum number of seconds to wait for the window to exist.

SearchProcessId.title: Search process Id
SearchProcessId.description: The optional process Id of the process which owns the window (for example, as provided by the output of the 'Run Process' action in the IA-Connect Environment / Session actions). Set to 0 to not search by process Id.

MatchIndex.title: Match index
MatchIndex.description: If multiple elements match the search, which element (starting at 1) should be matched. Can be used in conjunction with 'Sort by column' to choose the sort order for matching.

SearchFilter.title: Search filter
SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators against available window properties. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Title] like '*Excel' AND [IsMinimised] = False AND [IsResizeable] = True. See the documentation for more examples.

SortByColumn.title: Sort by column name
SortByColumn.description: If multiple windows match the search, this allows you to specify which window property to sort by. This will be used in conjunction with 'Match index' to pick the required window. For example: If 'Sort by column name' is [TopEdge] and 'Match index' is 1 then the matching window nearest the top of the screen will be returned.

MatchIndexAscending.title: Match index is ascending
MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple windows match the search, should 'Match index' match from the top of the sorted list (true) or from the bottom of the sorted list (false).

RaiseExceptionIfWindowNotFound.title: Raise exception if window not found
RaiseExceptionIfWindowNotFound.description: Should IA-Connect raise an exception if the search Win32 window does not exist after the wait period?

post.summary: Get UIA handle for process main window
post.description: A simple and fast Win32 action which returns the handle for any main window of a process (specified by name). The 'Main' window is typically the main application window: a login dialog or sub-window is generally not the 'Main' window.  The window must exist: IA-Connect will not wait. It is recommended to use the action 'Wait for desktop element' which is more powerful.

post.description: Reports whether an element exists and returns some basic element properties.

ParentWindowHandle.title: Parent window handle
ParentWindowHandle.description: The parent UIA window handle (a value of 1 or higher) to act as the starting point for the search. This can be discovered via Inspection using actions like 'Wait for desktop element' or 'Wait for element'.

SearchElementName.title: Search element name
SearchElementName.description: The optional UIA element name to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchElementClassName.title: Search element class name
SearchElementClassName.description: The optional UIA element class name to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchElementAutomationId.title: Search element automation ID
SearchElementAutomationId.description: The optional UIA element automation ID to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchLocalizedControlType.title: Search element localized control type
SearchLocalizedControlType.description: The optional UIA element localized control type to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchProcessId.title: Search process Id
SearchProcessId.description: If specified (a value of 1 or higher) then the search will only consider elements owned by a process with this Process ID (PID). If IA-Connect launched the process then the PID is provided by the 'Run Process' action in the IA-Connect Environment / Session actions. If you don't know the PID then leave this field blank (or 0).

SearchSubTree.title: Search UIA subtree
SearchSubTree.description: If set to true then the whole UIA tree below the parent window handle will be searched. This is more thorough but can take longer. If set to false, only elements directly below the parent window handle in the UIA tree will be searched.

ReturnElementHandle.title: Return element handle
ReturnElementHandle.description: If set to true, a handle to the located element will be returned. This handle can be used in further actions to act as a 'parent' handle.

MatchIndex.title: Match index
MatchIndex.description: If multiple elements match the search, which element (starting at 1) should be matched. Can be used in conjunction with 'Sort by column' to choose the sort order for matching.

SearchFilter.title: Search filter
SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators and any element field. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Name] like 'Document*' AND [ClassName] like 'Label*'. See the documentation for more examples.

SortByColumn.title: Sort by column name
SortByColumn.description: If multiple elements match the search, this allows you to specify which element property to sort by. This will be used in conjunction with 'Match index' to pick the required element. For example: If 'Sort by column name' is [TopEdge] and 'Match index' is 1 then the matching element nearest the top of the screen will be matched.

MatchIndexAscending.title: Match index is ascending
MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple elements match the search, should 'Match index' match from the top of the sorted list (true) or from the bottom of the sorted list (false).

IncludeChildProcesses.title: Include child processes
IncludeChildProcesses.description: If set to true and a 'Search process Id' is specified, child processes of that process Id are also included in the search. If set to false then only a process matching the exact 'Search process Id' will be searched.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

ElementExists.title: Element exists
ElementExists.description: Returns true if the element exists or false if not.

ElementHandle.title: Element handle
ElementHandle.description: The UIA handle for the element. This can be used as an input to further UIA actions acting on this element.

ElementName.title: Element name
ElementName.description: The UIA name of the element.

ElementClassName.title: Element class name
ElementClassName.description: The UIA class name of the element.

ElementAutomationId.title: Element automation Id
ElementAutomationId.description: The UIA automation Id of the element.

ElementLocalizedControlType.title: Element localized control type
ElementLocalizedControlType.description: The UIA localized control type of the element.

SearchLocalizedControlType.description: The optional UIA element localized control type to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchProcessId.title: Search process Id
SearchProcessId.description: If specified (a value of 1 or higher) then the search will only consider elements owned by a process with this Process ID (PID). If IA-Connect launched the process then the PID is provided by the 'Run Process' action in the IA-Connect Environment / Session actions. If you don't know the PID then leave this field blank (or 0).

SearchSubTree.title: Search UIA subtree
SearchSubTree.description: If set to true then the whole UIA tree below the parent window handle will be searched. This is more thorough but can take longer. If set to false, only elements directly below the parent window handle in the UIA tree will be searched.

ReturnElementHandle.title: Return element handle
ReturnElementHandle.description: If set to true, a handle to the located element will be returned. This handle can be used in further actions to act as a 'parent' handle.

SecondsToWait.title: Seconds to wait
SecondsToWait.description: The maximum number of seconds to wait for the element to exist.

MatchIndex.title: Match index
MatchIndex.description: If multiple elements match the search, which element (starting at 1) should be matched. Can be used in conjunction with 'Sort by column' to choose the sort order for matching.

SearchFilter.title: Search filter
SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators and any element field. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Name] like 'Document*' AND [ClassName] like 'Label*'. See the documentation for more examples.

SortByColumn.title: Sort by column name
SortByColumn.description: If multiple elements match the search, this allows you to specify which element property to sort by. This will be used in conjunction with 'Match index' to pick the required element. For example: If 'Sort by column name' is [TopEdge] and 'Match index' is 1 then the matching element nearest the top of the screen will be matched.

MatchIndexAscending.title: Match index is ascending
MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple elements match the search, should 'Match index' match from the top of the sorted list (true) or from the bottom of the sorted list (false).

IncludeChildProcesses.title: Include child processes
IncludeChildProcesses.description: If set to true and a 'Search process Id' is specified, child processes of that process Id are also included in the search. If set to false then only a process matching the exact 'Search process Id' will be returned.

RaiseExceptionIfElementNotFound.title: Raise exception if element not found
RaiseExceptionIfElementNotFound.description: Should IA-Connect raise an exception if the UIA element does not exist after the wait period?

ElementControlType.title: Element control type
ElementControlType.description: The UIA control type as a number. This is similar to localized control type but isn't language specific.

ElementLocalizedControlType.title: Element localized control type
ElementLocalizedControlType.description: The UIA localized control type of the element.

ElementIsEnabled.title: Element is enabled
ElementIsEnabled.description: Returns whether the element enabled or not.

ElementIsOffscreen.title: Element is offscreen
ElementIsOffscreen.description: Returns whether the element is offscreen or not.

ElementIsKeyboardFocusable.title: Element is keyboard focusable
ElementIsKeyboardFocusable.description: Returns whether the element can be focussed by the keyboard.

ElementHasKeyboardFocus.title: Element has keyboard focus
ElementHasKeyboardFocus.description: Returns whether the element currently has keyboard focus.

ElementIsPasswordField.title: Element is password field
ElementIsPasswordField.description: Returns whether an element is a password input field.

ElementAcceleratorKey.title: Element accelerator key
ElementAcceleratorKey.description: Returns the hotkey which could be pressed to activate the element.

ElementAccessKey.title: Element access key
ElementAccessKey.description: Returns the hotkey which could be pressed to activate a menu element.

ElementLeftEdge.title: Element left edge
ElementLeftEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the left edge of the element or window and the left edge of the display.

ElementRightEdge.title: Element right edge
ElementRightEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the right edge of the element or window and the left edge of the display.

ElementTopEdge.title: Element top edge
ElementTopEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the top edge of the element or window and the top edge of the display.

ElementBottomEdge.title: Element bottom edge
ElementBottomEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the bottom edge of the element or window and the top edge of the display.

ElementClickablePointX.title: Element clickable point X
ElementClickablePointX.description: The X coordinate in pixels of a central clickable point in the element relative to the left edge of the display as returned by the underlying application.

ElementClickablePointY.title: Element clickable point Y
ElementClickablePointY.description: The Y coordinate in pixels of a central clickable point in the element relative to the top edge of the display as returned by the underlying application.

ElementProcessId.title: Element process ID
ElementProcessId.description: The Process ID (PID) of the process which owns this element.

ElementHandle.title: Element handle
ElementHandle.description: If the input 'Return element handle' was set to true, this will hold a numeric element handle which can be used in further actions to act as a 'parent' handle for further actions.

ElementValue.title: Element value
ElementValue.description: If the input 'Return element value' was set to true and if the element has a value pattern, this will hold that value.

ElementTextValue.title: Element text value
ElementTextValue.description: If the input 'Return element value' was set to true and if the element has a text value pattern, this will hold that text value.

post.description: Returns the properties of multiple elements. This can be useful if you are uncertain which fields holds the property values required.

ParentWindowHandle.title: Parent window handle
ParentWindowHandle.description: The parent UIA window handle (a value of 1 or higher) to act as the starting point for the search. This can be discovered via Inspection using actions like 'Wait for desktop element' or 'Wait for element'.

SearchElementLocalizedControlType.title: Search element localized control type
SearchElementLocalizedControlType.description: The optional UIA element localized control type to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchDescendants.title: Search descendants
SearchDescendants.description: If set to true then the whole UIA tree below the parent window handle will be searched. This is more thorough but can take longer. If set to false, only elements directly below the parent window handle in the UIA tree will be searched.

ReturnElementHandle.title: Return element handle
ReturnElementHandle.description: If set to true, a handle to the located element will be returned. This handle can be used in further actions to act as a 'parent' handle.

ReturnElementValue.title: Return element value
ReturnElementValue.description: If set to true than the value of the located element will be returned.

FirstItemToReturn.title: First item to return
FirstItemToReturn.description: The element index of the first item to return, starting from 1. If you wish to return the elements in the reverse order (from the bottom of the UIA tree), you can alternatively specify a negative index starting from -1.

MaxItemsToReturn.title: Max items to return
MaxItemsToReturn.description: The maximum number of elements to return, or 0 to return all items.

NumberOfElementsReturned.title: Number of elements returned

SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators and any element field. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Name] like 'Document*' AND [ClassName] like 'Label*'. See the documentation for more examples.

SortByColumn.description: If multiple elements match the search, this allows you to specify which element property to sort by. MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple elements match the search, should 'Match index' match from the top of the sorted list (true) or from the bottom of the sorted list (false).

SearchLocalizedControlType.description: The optional UIA element localized control type to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchSubTree.title: Search UIA subtree
SearchSubTree.description: If set to true then the whole UIA tree below the parent window handle will be searched. This is more thorough but can take longer. If set to false, only elements directly below the parent window handle in the UIA tree will be searched.

OnScreenColumnsOnly.title: Retrieve Onscreen columns only
OnScreenColumnsOnly.description: If set to true then only onscreen columns will be returned.

OnScreenRowsOnly.title: Retrieve Onscreen rows only
OnScreenRowsOnly.description: If set to true then only onscreen rows will be returned.

ReturnNullValuesAsBlank.title: Return null values as blank
ReturnNullValuesAsBlank.description: If set to true, null values will be returned as '' (i.e. blank). If set to false, null values are typically returned as '(null)'.

AlternativeHeaderRowName.title: Alternative header row name
AlternativeHeaderRowName.description: By default, the header row in a DataGrid has the UIA element name 'Top Row'. If the header row has a different name, specify that name here.

ReturnRowUIAName.title: Return row UIA name
ReturnRowUIAName.description: If this input is set to then the row UIA name will be stored in a column in the output collection. The name of the column is defined by the input 'Name of column to store row UIA name'.

NameOfColumnToStoreRowUIAName.title: Name of column to store row UIA name
NameOfColumnToStoreRowUIAName.description: If the input 'Return row UIA name' is set to true then this input specifies the name of the column in the output collection to hold the row UIA name.

MatchIndex.title: Match index
MatchIndex.description: If multiple elements match the search, which element (starting at 1) should be matched. Can be used in conjunction with 'Sort by column' to choose the sort order for matching.

SearchFilter.title: Search filter
SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators and any element field. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Name] like 'Document*' AND [ClassName] like 'Label*'. See the documentation for more examples.

SortByColumn.title: Sort by column name
SortByColumn.description: If multiple elements match the search, this allows you to specify which element property to sort by. This will be used in conjunction with 'Match index' to pick the required element. For example: If 'Sort by column name' is [TopEdge] and 'Match index' is 1 then the matching element nearest the top of the screen will be matched.

MatchIndexAscending.title: Match index is ascending
MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple elements match the search, should 'Match index' match from the top of the sorted list (true) or from the bottom of the sorted list (false).

FirstItemToReturn.title: First item to return
FirstItemToReturn.description: The element index of the first item (row) to return, starting from 1.

MaxItemsToReturn.title: Max items to return
MaxItemsToReturn.description: The maximum number of items (rows) to return, or 0 to return all items (rows).

ScanFirstNRowsForEmptyRows.title: Scan first N rows for empty rows
ScanFirstNRowsForEmptyRows.description: Some datagrids have a few empty / null row elements in the UIA tree (usually at the top) and IA-Connect will automatically skip these row elements since they don't represent anything in the table which is visible in the UI. If this input is set to 0 (the default), the IA-Connect Agent will always scan row elements from the first row onwards, even if 'First item to return' is set to retrieve rows deeper within the table. This ensures consistency with row index numbers but impacts performance since all rows from the first row to the requested row(s) need to be scanned. If you are certain the only empty / null row elements in the table are within the first N (e.g. 10) rows, you can set this to N (e.g. 10) to potentially improve performance. Do not set to a value other than 0 unless you know what you are doing.

ReadTableAsThread.title: Read table as thread
ReadTableAsThread.description: If set to false (the default), the IA-Connect Agent will read the table immediately and return the contents to the Director. If reading large tables, this action may time out. If set to true, the IA-Connect Agent will read the table as an Agent thread and the IA-Connect Director (or Orchestrator, PowerShell module, Blue Prism) can monitor the status of this Agent thread, waiting for it to complete. This allows large tables to be read without timeouts. IA-Connect Agents 9.3 and earlier could only read tables immediately, not as an Agent thread.

RetrieveOutputDataFromThreadId.title: Retrieve output data for thread Id
RetrieveOutputDataFromThreadId.description: If you previously ran this action as an Agent thread and set 'Seconds to wait for thread' to 0, provide the Agent thread Id to retrieve the results. This Agent thread Id will have been provided by the earlier call to this action. Set to 0 (the default) if you are reading a datagrid (and hence not retrieving the results of a previous query run as an Agent thread).

SecondsToWaitForThread.title: Seconds to wait for thread
SecondsToWaitForThread.description: If 'Read table as thread' is set to true, how many seconds to wait for the Agent thread to complete. If the Agent thread reading the table hasn't completed in this time, an exception will be raised. Set to 0 to bypass the wait: The Agent will continue to read the datagrid, but also be available for the next action. You can then retrieve the results (the contents of the datagrid) at a later time by using the action 'Wait for Agent thread to complete successfully' to wait for the Agent thread to complete and then re-run this 'Get UIA datagrid element contents' action with the input 'Retrieve output data for thread Id' set to the Agent thread Id.

ScrollDataGridVerticallyEveryNPercent.title: Scroll datagrid vertically every N percent
ScrollDataGridVerticallyEveryNPercent.description: The performance of reading some large datagrids (for example: with thousands of rows) has been observed to improve if you periodically scroll the datagrid into (or near) the location being scrolled. If set to 0 (the default), the datagrid will not be scrolled while reading the contents. If set to a value between 1 and 100, the datagrid will periodically be scrolled (every N percent of the total number of rows) while reading the contents. For example: If set to 20, the datagrid will be scrolled at 0, 20, 40, 60, 80 percent. Alternatively, use 'Scroll datagrid vertically every N rows' to scroll every N rows instead of every N percent.

ScrollDataGridVerticallyEveryNRows.title: Scroll datagrid vertically every N rows
ScrollDataGridVerticallyEveryNRows.description: The performance of reading some large datagrids (for example: with thousands of rows) has been observed to improve if you periodically scroll the datagrid into (or near) the location being scrolled. If set to 0 (the default), the datagrid will not be scrolled while reading the contents. If set to a value 1 or higher, the datagrid will be scrolled every N rows while reading the contents. For example: If set to 5, the datagrid will be scrolled every 5 rows. Alternatively, use 'Scroll datagrid vertically every N percent' to scroll every N percent of the rows instead of every N rows.

ScrollDataGridVerticallyElementHandle.title: Scroll datagrid vertically element handle
ScrollDataGridVerticallyElementHandle.description: If scrolling the datagrid vertically while reading contents, this input defines how IA-Connect will locate the vertical scrollbar. If set to 0, IA-Connect will attempt to scroll the datagrid directly, either by using the 'scroll' pattern (if the datagrid supports it) or by searching for the vertical scrollbar contained within the datagrid. Alternatively, you can specify the IA-Connect UIA handle of the vertical scrollbar element (the scrollbar element itself, not the buttons within) which is a value of 1 or higher.

MinimumDataGridRowsForScrolling.title: Minimum datagrid rows for scrolling
MinimumDataGridRowsForScrolling.description: If scrolling the datagrid vertically while reading contents, this input specifies the minimum numbers of rows required in the table before IA-Connect will perform scrolling. If set to 0, IA-Connect will scroll regardless of the number of rows. If set to a positive number, IA-Connect will only perform scrolling when the datagrid has that number of rows or more.

RaiseExceptionIfCannotScroll.title: Raise exception if cannot scroll
RaiseExceptionIfCannotScroll.description: If scrolling the datagrid vertically while reading contents: Set this input to true if a failure to scroll should be considered an exception, or set to false (the default) if a failure to scroll should be ignored. Common failures to scroll include failing to locate the scrollbars or the scrollbars don't have a UIA pattern suitable for scrolling ('scroll', 'rangevalue' or 'value').

AlternativeVerticalScrollbarName.title: Alternative vertical scrollbar name
AlternativeVerticalScrollbarName.description: By default, the vertical scrollbar 'row' in a datagrid has the UIA element name 'Vertical Scroll Bar'. If the vertical scrollbar has a different name, specify that name here. This will be used if you want IA-Connect to periodically scroll the datagrid while reading the contents, the input 'Scroll datagrid vertically element handle' field is set to 0 (specifying that IA-Connect should scroll the datagrid directly) but the datagrid doesn't implement the 'scroll' pattern.

NumberOfColumnsInTable.title: Number of columns in table

SearchFilter.title: Search filter

SortByColumn.title: Sort by column name
SortByColumn.description: If multiple elements match the search, this allows you to specify which element property to sort by. This will be used in conjunction with 'Match index' to pick the required element. For example: If 'Sort by column name' is [TopEdge] and 'Match index' is 1 then the matching element nearest the top of the screen will be matched.

MatchIndexAscending.title: Match index is ascending
MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple elements match the search, should 'Match index' match from the top of the sorted list (true) or from the bottom of the sorted list (false).

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

SearchSubTree.title: Search UIA subtree
SearchSubTree.description: If set to true then the whole UIA tree below the parent window handle will be searched. This is more thorough but can take longer. If set to false, only elements directly below the parent window handle in the UIA tree will be searched.

ExpandFirst.title: Expand first
ExpandFirst.description: If set to true then IA-Connect will attempt to expand the list before searching for the list item elements. This is useful for dynamic lists as the list item elements may not be created until the list is expanded.

CollapseAfter.title: Collapse after
CollapseAfter.description: If set to true then the list will be collapsed after executing the search.

CheckForSelectedItems.title: Check for selected items
CheckForSelectedItems.description: If set to true then the output collection will contain an additional property indicating whether the list item is currently selected.

SecondsBetweenExpandCollapse.title: Seconds between expand and collapse
SecondsBetweenExpandCollapse.description: The number of seconds to wait between the expand and collapse actions if these are set to true.

FocusElement.title: Focus element first
FocusElement.description: Should IA-Connect attempt to focus the element before global clicking?

GlobalMouseClickOnElement.title: Global left mouse click on element
GlobalMouseClickOnElement.description: Should a global mouse click be performed at the element coordinates (to focus the element) before entering text?

ReplaceExistingValueUsingDoubleClickDele.title: Replace existing value using double mouse click delete
ReplaceExistingValueUsingDoubleClickDele.description: Should any existing value be replaced by double clicking the mouse (to highlight it) and then deleting?

ReplaceExistingValueUsingCTRLADelete.title: Replace existing value using CTRL-A delete
ReplaceExistingValueUsingCTRLADelete.description: Should any existing value be replaced by pressing Ctrl-A (to highlight all) and then deleting? Some elements may not support highlighting with Ctrl-A in which case the alternative option of 'Replace existing value using double mouse click delete' should be tried.

PasswordToInput.title: Password to input
PasswordToInput.description: The password value to global input using the keyboard.

SendKeyEvents.title: Use send key events
SendKeyEvents.description: If set to true then send key events (a lower level API which sends simulated keystrokes to the operating system) will be used. If set to false then send keys (a higher level API which sends keystrokes to the focused element) will be used instead.

Interval.title: Interval in milliseconds
Interval.description: The number of milliseconds between each key press.

DontInterpretSymbols.title: Dont interpret symbols
DontInterpretSymbols.description: Should symbols in the 'Password to input' not be interpreted as special keys (e.g. + for Shift, ^ for Ctrl)? This should be set to true if you are attempting to input the actual symbols.

PasswordContainsStoredPassword.title: Password contains stored password
PasswordContainsStoredPassword.description: Set to true if the password contains (or is entirely) an IA-Connect stored password identifier, in the format {IAConnectPassword:StoredPasswordIdentifier} or an IA-Connect Orchestrator generic credential, in the format {OrchestratorCredential:FriendlyName}. This stored password could have been generated by the 'Generate password' action, for example.

post.summary: Get multiple UIA parent element properties
post.description: Returns a hierarchal tree of parent elements of the specified element, all the way up to the desktop (root level). The parent element is defined as the element which is at the next level up the UIA 'tree' and is almost always a containing element.

ElementHandle.title: Element handle
ElementHandle.description: The UIA handle for the target element.

MaxParentsToProcess.title: Max parents to process
MaxParentsToProcess.description: The maximum number of parent elements to process. By default, this is set to 50.

NumberOfParentElementsReturned.title: Number of parent elements returned
NumberOfParentElementsReturned.description: The number of parent elements returned from the search.

post.summary: Search for first UIA parent element
post.description: Searches up the UIA tree hierarchy for the first parent element which matches the search criteria. The parent element is defined as the element which is at the next level up the UIA 'tree' and is almost always a containing element.

MaxParentsToProcess.title: Max parents to process

ParentElementFound.title: Parent element found
ParentElementFound.description: Returns true if the search parent UIA element was found.

ParentElementHandle.title: Parent element handle
ParentElementHandle.description: The UIA handle for the located parent element. This can be used as an input to further UIA actions acting on this element.

ParentElementName.title: Parent element name
ParentElementName.description: The UIA name of the located parent element.

ParentElementClassName.title: Parent element class name
ParentElementClassName.description: The UIA class name of the located parent element.

ParentElementAutomationId.title: Parent element automation Id
ParentElementAutomationId.description: The UIA automation Id of the located parent element.

ParentElementLocalizedControlType.title: Parent element localized control type
ParentElementLocalizedControlType.description: The UIA localized control type of the located parent element.

post.summary: Get multiple UIA elements as table
post.description: Enumerates the values of child elements of a specified parent element and returns in a table format. This can be used to return rows and columns of data from elements which aren't technically tables, but have been arranged together into a table structure. This action can also be used to retrieve the results from a previous execution of this action, run as an Agent thread.

ParentWindowHandle.title: Parent window handle
ParentWindowHandle.description: The parent UIA window handle (a value of 1 or higher) to act as the starting point for the search. This can be discovered via Inspection using actions like 'Wait for desktop element' or 'Wait for element'.

SearchElementName.title: Search element name
SearchElementName.description: The optional UIA element name to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchElementClassName.title: Search element class name
SearchElementClassName.description: The optional UIA element class name to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchElementAutomationId.title: Search element automation ID
SearchElementAutomationId.description: The optional UIA element automation ID to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchLocalizedControlType.title: Search element localized control type
SearchLocalizedControlType.description: The optional UIA element localized control type to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchSubTree.title: Search UIA subtree
SearchSubTree.description: If set to true then the whole UIA tree below the parent window handle will be searched. This is more thorough but can take longer. If set to false, only elements directly below the parent window handle in the UIA tree will be searched.

MatchIndex.title: Match index
MatchIndex.description: If multiple elements match the search, which element (starting at 1) should be matched. Can be used in conjunction with 'Sort by column' to choose the sort order for matching.

SearchFilter.title: Search filter
SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators and any element field. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Name] like 'Document*' AND [ClassName] like 'Label*'. See the documentation for more examples.

SortByColumn.title: Sort by column name
SortByColumn.description: If multiple elements match the search, this allows you to specify which element property to sort by. This will be used in conjunction with 'Match index' to pick the required element. For example: If 'Sort by column name' is [TopEdge] and 'Match index' is 1 then the matching element nearest the top of the screen will be matched.

MatchIndexAscending.title: Match index is ascending
MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple elements match the search, should 'Match index' match from the top of the sorted list (true) or from the bottom of the sorted list (false).

SearchCellHeaderSubElementLocalizedContr.title: Search cell header subelement localized control type
SearchCellHeaderSubElementLocalizedContr.description: The cell header subelement localized control type to search for. Leave blank if not searching for cell headers.

SearchCellHeaderSubElementControlType.title: Search cell header subelement control type
SearchCellHeaderSubElementControlType.description: The cell header subelement control type (an non-localized integer) to search for. This is the same value across different languages. Leave at 0 if not searching for cell headers.

SearchCellSubElementLocalizedControlType.title: Search cell subelement localized control type
SearchCellSubElementLocalizedControlType.description: The cell subelement localized control type to search for.

SearchCellSubElementControlType.title: Search cell subelement control type
SearchCellSubElementControlType.description: The cell subelement control type (an non-localized integer) to search for. This is the same value across different languages.

SearchDescendantsForCellSubElements.title: Search descendants for cell subelements
SearchDescendantsForCellSubElements.description: If set to true then the UIA tree below the located element will be searched for cell and cell header subelements (i.e. the element values which will populate the cells in the output table). This is more thorough but can take longer. You may wish to set this to false if you are only interested in elements directly beneath the element.

FirstCellHeaderSubElementToReturn.title: First cell header subelement to return
FirstCellHeaderSubElementToReturn.description: The index of the first cell header subelement to return, starting from 1. If you wish to return the elements in the reverse order (from the bottom of the UIA tree), you can alternatively specify a negative index starting from -1.

MaxCellHeaderSubElementsToReturn.title: Max cell header subelements to return
MaxCellHeaderSubElementsToReturn.description: The maximum number of cell header subelements to return, or 0 to return all subelements.

FirstCellSubElementToReturn.title: First cell subelement to return
FirstCellSubElementToReturn.description: The index of the first cell subelement to return, starting from 1. If you wish to return the elements in the reverse order (from the bottom of the UIA tree), you can alternatively specify a negative index starting from -1.

MaxCellSubElementsToReturn.title: Max cell subelements to return
MaxCellSubElementsToReturn.description: The maximum number of cell subelements to return, or 0 to return all subelements.

RequestedNumberOfColumns.title: Requested number of columns
RequestedNumberOfColumns.description: The number of columns you would like in the output table. This value must be correct for the element being read, or you will receive unexpected results.

CellSubElementValuePriority.title: Cell subelement value priority
CellSubElementValuePriority.description: The priority for using the cell subelement value as the value to use in the output table. 1 is highest priority. 2 is second priority. 3 is third priority. 0 is do not use.

CellSubElementTextValuePriority.title: Cell subelement text value priority
CellSubElementTextValuePriority.description: The priority for using the cell subelement text value as the value to use in the output table. 1 is highest priority. 2 is second priority. 3 is third priority. 0 is do not use.

CellSubElementNameValuePriority.title: Cell subelement name value priority
CellSubElementNameValuePriority.description: The priority for using the cell subelement name (common for labels) as the value to use in the output table. 1 is highest priority. 2 is second priority. 3 is third priority. 0 is do not use.

MinimumCellSubElementWidth.title: Minimum cell subelement width
MinimumCellSubElementWidth.description: The minimum width in pixels of a cell subelement to be included in the table.

MinimumCellSubElementHeight.title: Minimum cell subelement height
MinimumCellSubElementHeight.description: The minimum height in pixels of a cell subelement to be included in the table.

SearchCellSubElementBoundingBoxLeft.title: Search cell subelement bounding box left
SearchCellSubElementBoundingBoxLeft.description: Only include cell subelements which are fully contained within the bounding box. By default the bounding box is huge to include all elements.

SearchCellSubElementBoundingBoxRight.title: Search cell subelement bounding box right
SearchCellSubElementBoundingBoxRight.description: Only include cell subelements which are fully contained within the bounding box. By default the bounding box is huge to include all elements.

SearchCellSubElementBoundingBoxTop.title: Search cell subelement bounding box top
SearchCellSubElementBoundingBoxTop.description: Only include cell subelements which are fully contained within the bounding box. By default the bounding box is huge to include all elements.

SearchCellSubElementBoundingBoxBottom.title: Search cell subelement bounding box bottom
SearchCellSubElementBoundingBoxBottom.description: Only include cell subelements which are fully contained within the bounding box. By default the bounding box is huge to include all elements.

ReadTableAsThread.title: Read table as thread
ReadTableAsThread.description: If set to false (the default), the IA-Connect Agent will read the table immediately and return the contents to the Director. If reading large tables, this action may time out. If set to true, the IA-Connect Agent will read the table as an Agent thread and the IA-Connect Director (or Orchestrator, PowerShell module, Blue Prism) can monitor the status of this Agent thread, waiting for it to complete. This allows large tables to be read without timeouts. IA-Connect Agents 9.3 and earlier could only read tables immediately, not as an Agent thread.

RetrieveOutputDataFromThreadId.title: Retrieve output data for thread Id
RetrieveOutputDataFromThreadId.description: If you previously ran this action as an Agent thread and set 'Seconds to wait for thread' to 0, provide the Agent thread Id to retrieve the results. This Agent thread Id will have been provided by the earlier call to this action. Set to 0 (the default) if you are reading a table (and hence not retrieving the results of a previous query run as an Agent thread).

SecondsToWaitForThread.title: Seconds to wait for thread
SecondsToWaitForThread.description: If 'Read table as thread' is set to true, how many seconds to wait for the Agent thread to complete. If the Agent thread reading the table hasn't completed in this time, an exception will be raised. Set to 0 to bypass the wait: The Agent will continue to read the table, but also be available for the next action. You can then retrieve the results (the contents of the table) at a later time by using the action 'Wait for Agent thread to complete successfully' to wait for the Agent thread to complete and then re-run this 'Get multiple UIA elements as table' action with the input 'Retrieve output data for thread Id' set to the Agent thread Id.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

NumberOfCellSubElementsFound.title: Number of cell subelements found
NumberOfCellSubElementsFound.description: The number of cell subelements (not headers) found that match the search criteria.

NumberOfCellSubElementsReturned.title: Number of cell subelements returned
NumberOfCellSubElementsReturned.description: The number of cell subelements (not headers) returned (this can be lower than the number of elements found if specifying a first or maximum number of items to return).

TableContentsJSON.title: Table contents JSON
TableContentsJSON.description: The table created from the multiple element contents, in JSON format.

NumberOfRowsInTable.title: Number of rows in table
NumberOfRowsInTable.description: The number of rows in the output table.

NumberOfColumnsInTable.title: Number of columns in table
NumberOfColumnsInTable.description: The number of columns in the output table.

ThreadId.title: Thread Id
ThreadId.description: If this action is being run as an Agent thread, this output will hold the Agent thread Id which can be used to monitor the action's process and retrieve the table contents when the thread has completed.

post.description: Set the horizontal and / or vertical scroll percentage of the specified element, if scrolling is supported by that element. If the element supports the 'scroll' pattern, you can apply this action directly to the element and specify either a horizontal or vertical scroll amount (or both). If the element doesn't support the 'scroll' pattern this action will fall back to the 'range value' or 'value' patterns, but you will need to apply these directly to the scroll bar control(s), not the element itself.

ParentWindowHandle.title: Parent window handle
ParentWindowHandle.description: The parent UIA window handle (a value of 1 or higher) to act as the starting point for the search. This can be discovered via Inspection using actions like 'Wait for desktop element' or 'Wait for element'.

SearchElementName.title: Search element name
SearchElementName.description: The optional UIA element name to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchElementClassName.title: Search element class name
SearchElementClassName.description: The optional UIA element class name to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchElementAutomationId.title: Search element automation ID
SearchElementAutomationId.description: The optional UIA element automation ID to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchLocalizedControlType.title: Search element localized control type
SearchLocalizedControlType.description: The optional UIA element localized control type to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchSubTree.title: Search UIA subtree
SearchSubTree.description: If set to true then the whole UIA tree below the parent window handle will be searched. This is more thorough but can take longer. If set to false, only elements directly below the parent window handle in the UIA tree will be searched.

MatchIndex.title: Match index
MatchIndex.description: If multiple elements match the search, which element (starting at 1) should be matched. Can be used in conjunction with 'Sort by column' to choose the sort order for matching.

SearchFilter.title: Search filter
SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators and any element field. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Name] like 'Document*' AND [ClassName] like 'Label*'. See the documentation for more examples.

SortByColumn.title: Sort by column name
SortByColumn.description: If multiple elements match the search, this allows you to specify which element property to sort by. This will be used in conjunction with 'Match index' to pick the required element. For example: If 'Sort by column name' is [TopEdge] and 'Match index' is 1 then the matching element nearest the top of the screen will be matched.

MatchIndexAscending.title: Match index is ascending
MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple elements match the search, should 'Match index' match from the top of the sorted list (true) or from the bottom of the sorted list (false).

HorizontalScrollPercentage.title: Horizontal scroll percentage
HorizontalScrollPercentage.description: The position to horizontally scroll the element (0 to 100 inclusive, decimals supported) or -1 to leave the horizontal scroll position unchanged.

VerticalScrollPercentage.title: Vertical scroll percentage
VerticalScrollPercentage.description: The position to vertically scroll the element (0 to 100 inclusive, decimals supported) or -1 to leave the vertical scroll position unchanged.

TryScrollPattern.title: Try scroll pattern
TryScrollPattern.description: If set to true, the IA-Connect Agent will attempt to use a UIA scroll pattern to perform the scroll action. If the UIA scroll pattern is unavailable in the chosen element, the IA-Connect Agent will fall back to other chosen patterns (enabled or disabled via other inputs to this action). If set to false, the IA-Connect Agent will not attempt to use a scroll pattern and will immediately fall back to other chosen patterns. The order of patterns attempted (if enabled via inputs to this action) are scroll, range value and value.

TryRangeValuePattern.title: Try range value pattern
TryRangeValuePattern.description: If set to true, the IA-Connect Agent will attempt to use a UIA range value pattern to perform the scroll action. If the UIA range value pattern is unavailable in the chosen element, the IA-Connect Agent will fall back to other chosen patterns (enabled or disabled via other inputs to this action). If set to false, the IA-Connect Agent will not attempt to use a range value pattern and will immediately fall back to other chosen patterns. The order of patterns attempted (if enabled via inputs to this action) are scroll, range value and value.

TryValuePattern.title: Try value pattern
TryValuePattern.description: If set to true, the IA-Connect Agent will attempt to use a UIA value pattern to perform the scroll action. If the UIA value pattern is unavailable in the chosen element, the IA-Connect Agent will fall back to other chosen patterns (enabled or disabled via other inputs to this action). If set to false, the IA-Connect Agent will not attempt to use a value pattern and will immediately fall back to other chosen patterns. The order of patterns attempted (if enabled via inputs to this action) are scroll, range value and value. Warning: Using a value pattern on an edit element will simply enter the value into the edit element.

Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

UIASetElementScrollPercentageResult.title: Command result
UIASetElementScrollPercentageResult.description: The result of the command (success or failure).

ErrorMessage.title: Error message
ErrorMessage.description: If the command was not successful, this will contain the error message that was returned.

post.summary: Get UIA element search colour region
post.description: Returns the details of the region of pixels within a UIA element that meet the specified colour criteria. The element should be brought to the front first as the screenshot is taking a copy of the screen at the elements location.

ParentWindowHandle.title: Parent window handle
ParentWindowHandle.description: The parent UIA window handle (a value of 1 or higher) to act as the starting point for the search. This can be discovered via Inspection using actions like 'Wait for desktop element' or 'Wait for element'.

SearchElementName.title: Search element name
SearchElementName.description: The optional UIA element name to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchElementClassName.title: Search element class name
SearchElementClassName.description: The optional UIA element class name to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchElementAutomationId.title: Search element automation ID
SearchElementAutomationId.description: The optional UIA element automation ID to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchLocalizedControlType.title: Search element localized control type
SearchLocalizedControlType.description: The optional UIA element localized control type to search for (starting from the parent window handle). This can be discovered via Inspection.

SearchSubTree.title: Search UIA subtree
SearchSubTree.description: If set to true then the whole UIA tree below the parent window handle will be searched. This is more thorough but can take longer. If set to false, only elements directly below the parent window handle in the UIA tree will be searched.

MatchIndex.title: Match index
MatchIndex.description: If multiple elements match the search, which element (starting at 1) should be matched. Can be used in conjunction with 'Sort by column' to choose the sort order for matching.

SearchFilter.title: Search filter
SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators and any element field. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Name] like 'Document*' AND [ClassName] like 'Label*'. See the documentation for more examples.

SortByColumn.title: Sort by column name
SortByColumn.description: If multiple elements match the search, this allows you to specify which element property to sort by. This will be used in conjunction with 'Match index' to pick the required element. For example: If 'Sort by column name' is [TopEdge] and 'Match index' is 1 then the matching element nearest the top of the screen will be matched.

MatchIndexAscending.title: Match index is ascending
MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple elements match the search, should 'Match index' match from the top of the sorted list (true) or from the bottom of the sorted list (false).

SearchColour.title: Search colour
SearchColour.description: Search colour in the format 0xAARRGGBB, #AARRGGBB, 0xRRGGBB or #RRGGBB where each colour channel is a byte in hex format (00 is fully off, FF is fully on). For example: #FF0000 for red, #00FF00 for blue, #000000 for black, #FFFFFF for white.

MaxColourDeviation.title: Max colour deviation
MaxColourDeviation.description: The maximum an element colour can deviate from the search colour before it isn't considered a match. 0 for no deviation. Deviation is measured in RGB values. For example: #FF0000 is 4 different from #FE0102. A deviation of 15 would be a good starting point.

LeftPixelXOffset.title: Left pixel X offset
LeftPixelXOffset.description: An optional X offset for the left edge of the search area. This allows you to increase (with negative values) or decrease (with positive values) the search area.

RightPixelXOffset.title: Right pixel X offset
RightPixelXOffset.description: An optional X offset for the right edge of the search area. This allows you to increase (with positive values) or decrease (with negative values) the search area.

TopPixelYOffset.title: Top pixel Y offset
TopPixelYOffset.description: An optional Y offset for the top edge of the search area. This allows you to increase (with negative values) or decrease (with positive values) the search area.

BottomPixelYOffset.title: Bottom pixel Y offset
BottomPixelYOffset.description: An optional Y offset for the bottom edge of the search area. This allows you to increase (with positive values) or decrease (with negative values) the search area.

HideAgent.title: Hide Agent
HideAgent.description: Set to true to automatically hide the Agent (if visible) to ensure it doesn't obscure the element being analysed.

ReturnPhysicalCoordinates.title: Return screen coordinates as physical
ReturnPhysicalCoordinates.description: Set to true for the screen coordinates to be returned as physical coordinates. Set to false for the screen coordinates to be returned as virtual coordinates. If the underlying display scaling is 100%, both physical and virtual coordinates are the same. Element coordinates are always returned as virtual coordinates.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

NumberOfPixelsMatchingColour.title: Number of pixels matching colour
NumberOfPixelsMatchingColour.description: The number of pixels which match the specified colour.

ColourMatchBoundingBoxElementLeftPixelXC.title: Colour match bounding box element left pixel
ColourMatchBoundingBoxElementLeftPixelXC.description: The virtual X-coordinate of the left-most pixel matching the specified colour, relative to the element virtual top-left.

ColourMatchBoundingBoxElementRightPixelX.title: Colour match bounding box element right pixel
ColourMatchBoundingBoxElementRightPixelX.description: The virtual X-coordinate of the right-most pixel matching the specified colour, relative to the element virtual top-left.

ColourMatchBoundingBoxElementTopPixelYCo.title: Colour match bounding box element top pixel
ColourMatchBoundingBoxElementTopPixelYCo.description: The virtual Y-coordinate of the top-most pixel matching the specified colour, relative to the element virtual top-left.

ColourMatchBoundingBoxElementBottomPixel.title: Colour match bounding box element bottom pixel
ColourMatchBoundingBoxElementBottomPixel.description: The virtual Y-coordinate of the bottom-most pixel matching the specified colour, relative to the element virtual top-left.

ColourMatchBoundingBoxElementCenterPixel.title: Colour match bounding box element center X pixel
ColourMatchBoundingBoxElementCenterPixel.description: The virtual X-coordinate of the center of the bounding box containing pixels matching the specified colour, relative to the element virtual top-left.

ColourMatchBoundingBoxElementCenterPixel.title: Colour match bounding box element center Y pixel
ColourMatchBoundingBoxElementCenterPixel.description: The virtual Y-coordinate of the center of the bounding box containing pixels matching the specified colour, relative to the element virtual top-left.

ColourMatchBoundingBoxScreenLeftPixelXCo.title: Colour match bounding box screen left pixel
ColourMatchBoundingBoxScreenLeftPixelXCo.description: The screen pixel X-coordinate of the left-most pixel matching the specified colour. This is either a physical or virtual coordinate depending on the input 'Return physical coordinates'.

ColourMatchBoundingBoxScreenRightPixelXC.title: Colour match bounding box screen right pixel
ColourMatchBoundingBoxScreenRightPixelXC.description: The screen pixel X-coordinate of the right-most pixel matching the specified colour. This is either a physical or virtual coordinate depending on the input 'Return physical coordinates'.

ColourMatchBoundingBoxScreenTopPixelYCoo.title: Colour match bounding box screen top pixel
ColourMatchBoundingBoxScreenTopPixelYCoo.description: The screen pixel Y-coordinate of the top-most pixel matching the specified colour. This is either a physical or virtual coordinate depending on the input 'Return physical coordinates'.

ColourMatchBoundingBoxScreenBottomPixelY.title: Colour match bounding box screen bottom pixel
ColourMatchBoundingBoxScreenBottomPixelY.description: The screen pixel Y-coordinate of the bottom-most pixel matching the specified colour. This is either a physical or virtual coordinate depending on the input 'Return physical coordinates'.

ColourMatchBoundingBoxScreenCenterPixelX.title: Colour match bounding box screen center X pixel
ColourMatchBoundingBoxScreenCenterPixelX.description: The screen pixel X-coordinate of the center of the bounding box containing pixels matching the specified colour. This is either a physical or virtual coordinate depending on the input 'Return physical coordinates'.

ColourMatchBoundingBoxScreenCenterPixelY.title: Colour match bounding box screen center Y pixel
ColourMatchBoundingBoxScreenCenterPixelY.description: The screen pixel Y-coordinate of the center of the bounding box containing pixels matching the specified colour. This is either a physical or virtual coordinate depending on the input 'Return physical coordinates'.

post.description: A fast Win32 action which returns a list of all Win32 windows which optionally have the specified class name or window title, or you can specify more advanced search filters, including wildcards. Although this action uses Win32 APIs, it can detect Windows, Java, ModernUI and Web windows. Win32 Windows can include unexpected items including the taskbar, desktop, start menu, transparent overlays, offscreen or hidden windows, so the returned list may contain more results than expected.

SearchClassName.title: Search class name
SearchClassName.description: The optional class name of the top level window to search for, e.g. 'Chrome_WidgetWin_1'.

SearchWindowTitle.title: Search window title
SearchWindowTitle.description: The optional title of the top level window to search for.

TopLevelWindowsOnly.title: Only retrieve top level windows
TopLevelWindowsOnly.description: Set to true to only retrieve Win32 windows which the OS considers to be top-level. Set to false to retrieve all Win32 windows. Note that the Win32 definition of a window will include items you might not recognise as a window and many dialogs and message boxes are marked as top-level even though they are a child of a parent window.

VisibleWindowsOnly.title: Only retrieve visible windows
VisibleWindowsOnly.description: Set to true to only retrieve Win32 windows which the OS considers to be visible. Set to false to retrieve both visible and non-visible Win32 windows. Note that offscreen or transparent windows might be marked as visible, but you cannot see them.

WindowsWithTitlebarOnly.title: Only retrieve windows with a title bar
WindowsWithTitlebarOnly.description: Set to true to only retrieve Win32 windows with a title bar. Set to false to retrieve Win32 windows regardless of whether they have a title bar or not. Note that some transparent windows have title bars but you cannot see them.

WindowsWithTitleOnly.title: Only retrieve windows with a title
WindowsWithTitleOnly.description: Set to true to only retrieve Win32 windows with a title (i.e. a title bar containing some text). Set to false to retrieve Win32 windows regardless of whether they have a title. Note that the title bar is the strip across the top of the window whereas the title is the text within it.

IgnoreTransparentWindows.title: Ignore transparent windows
IgnoreTransparentWindows.description: Set to true to only retrieve Win32 windows which do not have transparency. Set to false to retrieve Win32 windows regardless of whether they have transparency set or not.

SearchProcessId.title: Search process Id
SearchProcessId.description: The optional process Id of the process which owns the windows (for example, as provided by the output of the 'Run Process' action in the IA-Connect Environment / Session actions). Set to 0 to not search by process Id.

SearchFilter.title: Search filter
SearchFilter.description: An optional advanced filter to further restrict the search using conditional operators and any element field. Example 1: [Width] < 200. Example 2: [Title] like '*Excel' AND [IsMinimised] = False AND [IsResizeable] = True. See the documentation for more examples.

SortByColumn.title: Sort by column name
SortByColumn.description: If multiple windows match the search, this allows you to specify which window property to sort by. For example: If 'Sort by column name' is [TopEdge] then the list of windows will be returned ordered by top edge. If this field is left blank, windows will be returned in the order they are detected.

MatchIndexAscending.title: Match index is ascending
MatchIndexAscending.description: If multiple windows match the search and a sort column is specified, set to true (default) to sort ascending or set to false to sort descending.

ReturnElementHandle.title: Return UIA element handle
ReturnElementHandle.description: If set to true, a UIA handle to each located Win32 window will be returned in the output collection (in the column 'UIAHandle'). This handle can be used in further actions to act as a 'parent' handle in IA-Connect UIA actions.

FirstItemToReturn.title: First item to return
FirstItemToReturn.description: The index of the first window (row) to return, starting from 1.

MaxItemsToReturn.title: Max items to return
MaxItemsToReturn.description: The maximum number of windows to return, or 0 to return all items.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

Win32WindowsJSON.title: Win32 windows JSON
Win32WindowsJSON.description: A list of Win32 windows matching the search criteria, in JSON format.

NumberOfWin32Windows.title: Number of Win32 windows
NumberOfWin32Windows.description: The number of Win32 windows returned.
